newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Tax debtor Tebukneft said not part of Komineft.
newsitem.headline: Tax debtor Tebukneft said not part of Komineft.

text.p: Russia's OAO Tebukneft, cited as a target for tax non-payment by the Federal Bankruptcy Administration, is not a subsidiary of regional oil company Komineft, its registrar said on Wednesday.

A Bankruptcy Administration press release said Tebukneft was a subsidiary of Komineft, the main operating unit of northern Russia regional oil company KomiTEK, and owed 122.3 billion roubles ($22.1 million) in tax arrears.
But Natalya Prikhodko of the Moscow Central Depository said Tebukneft had been spun off from Komineft on July 22.
"The firm (Tebukneft) became independent and is not part of any other oil company," she said.
The Bankruptcy Administration said it had summoned officials from KomiTEK to discuss tax arrears of 290 billion roubles owed by its subsidiaries.
